Articles.Content:
New parts for ISRU of various gases

**==REQUIRES COMMUNITYRESOURCEPACK==**

Compatible with tweakscale.

Recommended for use with Near Future Propulsion.

**The Blue Drill** 

![dpz3gm.jpg](http://i63.tinypic.com/dpz3gm.jpg)

Managed resources: Argon and Xenon from planetary surfaces or asteroids

**Download:**

[http://www.spacedock.info/mod/292/The%20Blue%20Drill](http://www.spacedock.info/mod/292/The%20Blue%20Drill)

**LIcense: MIT**

**========================================================================================**

**The Blue Scoop:**

[![10zq075.jpg](http://i67.tinypic.com/10zq075.jpg)](http://i67.tinypic.com/10zq075.jpg)

Managed resources: Argon, Xenon and Hydrogen from atmospheres of planets

**Download:**

[http://www.spacedock.info/mod/294/The%20Blue%20Scoop](http://www.spacedock.info/mod/294/The%20Blue%20Scoop)

**License: MIT**

**=========================================================================**

**Optional ModuleManager patch for stock converters**

**Installation:** Put in the GameData folder

**Download:**

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/05mt874y74n6s1v/xenon%20and%20argon.cfg?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/05mt874y74n6s1v/xenon%20and%20argon.cfg?dl=0)

**License: MIT**

**Edited <time datetime="2016-02-27T10:47:56Z" title="02/27/2016 10:47  AM" data-short="8 yr">February 27, 2016</time> by silversliver**

Welcome to the forum! 

I don't use NFP myself but I'm sure someone will find it very useful!

Can it extract Liquid Hydrogen too?

If not can you add it

Well do you have any suggestions on where to extract it?

Edit: If you have Near Future Propulsion you can use stock Ore to convert in LH2

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-17T11:45:31Z" title="08/17/2015 11:45  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 17, 2015</time> by silversliver**

> 
> Well do you have any suggestions on where to extract it?
> Edit: If you have Near Future Propulsion you can use stock Ore to convert in LH2

Didn't realise that you can convert it in LH2 with NFP!

Edit: You are right! I tested it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-17T15:05:01Z" title="08/17/2015 03:05  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 17, 2015</time> by kovdan13**

Very well fellow player.

If you need Hydrogen directly soon you can extract it from atmospheres.

Updated for The Blue Scoop.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-20T20:05:04Z" title="08/20/2015 08:05  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 20, 2015</time> by silversliver**
Dude, this mod is tight! I use ions for all interplanetary transfers, this just made things way more practical!
Thanks, fellow player.

How do I harvest/scan Xenon and Argon?

- - - Updated - - -

Which resource do i need to harvest xenon gas?

Keep on the good work!

> 
> How do I harvest/scan Xenon and Argon?
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> Which resource do i need to harvest xenon gas?
> 
> Keep on the good work!

If you have installed CommunityResourcePack (is required) the stock orbital scanner and surface scanning module are sufficient.

For planets and moons you have to look in the Atmosphere tab of the resources.

Asteroids are the best places for Xenon and Argon.

I don't understand the second question? Maybe you mean that you need electric charge to make the atmospheric extractor and the drill function?
Does it use the stock models and textures?

> 
> Does it use the stock models and textures?

Stock models and custom textures.

> 
> If you have installed CommunityResourcePack (is required) the stock orbital scanner and surface scanning module are sufficient.
> For planets and moons you have to look in the Atmosphere tab of the resources.
> 
> Asteroids are the best places for Xenon and Argon.
> 
> I don't understand the second question? Maybe you mean that you need electric charge to make the atmospheric extractor and the drill function?

The first one was my fault! Haven't installed the Community Resource Pack!

I scanned Kerbin and the xenon or Argon are in the ocean or atmosphere i can't harvest the ocean and for the atmosphere is the scoop.

How do I use the drill? Can't find any place to drill. Can I drill only on Asteroids or on planets too?

Hope I don't sound like a complete idiot. ![icon6.png](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/images/icons/icon6.png)

EDIT:

Grabbed an Asteroid tried to harvest it but my EMPTY Xenon gas Tank doesn't fill up. Am I doing something wrong!

EDIT2: 

Forget everything i asked! I succesfully harvested an asteroid! Keep on the work and don't think about my dumbness anymore!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-09-19T16:06:38Z" title="09/19/2015 04:06  PM" data-short="8 yr">September 19, 2015</time> by kovdan13**
The drill is only for asteroids, although is not very realistic that there are rare gases on such small bodies.
Up for 1.0.5
this magic drill is good working on kerbin. but on the Mun it cant. I can only retract and deploy it. I think that there no argon in the Mun and Minmus? Is it true?

> 
> 
> 23 hours ago, starship said:
> 
> 
> this magic drill is good working on kerbin. but on the Mun it cant. I can only retract and deploy it. I think that there no argon in the Mun and Minmus? Is it true?
> 

No, actually for the drill you must use an asteroid, there isn't argon or xenon on planets.

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, silversliver said:
> 
> 
> No, actually for the drill you must use an asteroid, there isn't argon or xenon on planets.
> 

its a very bad. But I can  harvest  argon and xenon on Kerbin. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:") Can you add a opportunity to harvest this important fuels on the moons too, оr make a some mod allows extracting argon and xenon in stock convertor from ore? Now i can extract lithium but not argon and xenon. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif ":blush:")

> 
> 
> 18 minutes ago, starship said:
> 
> 
> its a very bad. But I can  harvest  argon and xenon on Kerbin. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif ":confused:") Can you add a opportunity to harvest this important fuels on the moons too, оr make a some mod allows extracting argon and xenon in stock convertor from ore? Now i can extract lithium but not argon and xenon. ![:blush:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_embarrassed.gif ":blush:")
> 

Yes, I checked and it's a bug, thanks for reporting.

No, I'll not add the extraction to the drill because it's unrealistic (it already is with asteroids but whatever).

Optionally I added a ModuleManager patch for both of the stock converters.

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, silversliver said:
> 
> 
> Yes, I checked and it's a bug, thanks for reporting.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> No, I'll not add the extraction to the drill because it's unrealistic (it already is with asteroids but whatever).
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Optionally I added a ModuleManager patch for both of the stock converters.
> 

But asteroids is only near Kerin space? And after a few times of study cfg files i understand that any rare gases and etc is only in asteroids?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, starship said:
> 
> 
> But asteroids is only near Kerin space? And after a few times of study cfg files i understand that any rare gases and etc is only in asteroids?
> 

If you have the Asteroid Day mod you can spawn asteroids around all the planets, if you don't have it the asteroids are only around Kerbin and in Dres orbit.

The rare gases are in asteroids, in the planets atmospheres, and Xenon is also in water (kerbin, laythe, eve).

mmmm...... in this situation i cant build a refueling stotion in Wall orbit. And i want travel to the another star system too. And  Asteroid Day  is not compatible with 1 0 5

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-03T20:12:49Z" title="01/03/2016 08:12  PM" data-short="8 yr">January 3, 2016</time> by starship**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, starship said:
> 
> 
> And  Asteroid Day  is not compatible with 1 0 5
> 

it is, you have to download it from Curse, not Kerbalstuff

[http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/232196-asteroid-day#t1:other-downloads](http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/232196-asteroid-day#t1:other-downloads)

Also check the MM patch that I added to the first post.
Updated to SpaceDock.
